name: International Platform of Insects for Food & Feed Association
goal:
IPIFF is an EU non-profit organisation which represents the interests of the insect production sector towards EU policy makers, European stakeholders & citizens. Composed of more than 30 members, most of which are European insect producing companies, IPIFF promotes the use of insects & insect derived products as top tier source of nutrients for human consumption & animal feed.

IPIFF main mission is to promote the wider use of insects as an alternative or new source of protein for human consumption & animal feed through continuous dialogue with EU decision makers (i.e. European Commission, EU Member States authorities, European Parliament & European Food Safety Authority). Notably, IPIFF centres its activities around advocating for appropriate EU legislative frameworks to apply to insect production.

The association also supports its members in the effective implementation of EU food & feed safety legislations, such as through the promotion and/or development of shared standards.

More generally, IPIFF aims to communicate on the benefits of eating insects and/or their use as animal feed towards the wider public
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Research and Technology
